00098 /////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00099 // Routines for dealing with names.
00100 /////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00101 
00102 /**
00103  * compare two names
00104  * advances both decoders, but early exit may leave them not fully over the names
00105  * decoder error flags may be useful, though, if any errors occur
00106  */
00107 int
00108 SyncCmpNamesInner(struct ccn_buf_decoder *xx, struct ccn_buf_decoder *yy);
00109 
00110 /**
00111  * compare two names
00112  * @returns >1 if cbx > cby, 0 if cby == cby, <-1 if cbx < cby
00113  * @returns BAD_CMP for a parsing error
00114  */
00115 #define SYNC_BAD_CMP (-2)
00116 int
00117 SyncCmpNames(const struct ccn_charbuf *cbx, const struct ccn_charbuf *cby);
00118 
00119 /**
00120  * tests to see if charbuf refers to a name
00121  * @returns 1 for a name, 0 otherwise
00122  */
00123 int
00124 SyncIsName(const struct ccn_charbuf *cb);
00125 
00126 /**
00127  * @returns number of components in the name
00128  */
00129 int
00130 SyncComponentCount(const struct ccn_charbuf *name);
00131 
00132 /**
00133  * simple pattern matching, where the pattern may contain components with
00134  * a single 255 byte to match a single name component
00135  * @returns number of matching components in the pattern if the name
00136  * (starting at component index start) matches the prefix,
00137  * @returns -1 if there is a parsing error or no match
00138  */
00139 int
00140 SyncPatternMatch(const struct ccn_charbuf *pattern,
00141                  const struct ccn_charbuf *name,
00142                  int start);
00143 
00144 /**
00145  * @returns number of components in the prefix if the name
00146  * (starting at component index start) matches the prefix,
00147  * @returns -1 if there is a parsing error or no match
00148  */
00149 int
00150 SyncPrefixMatch(const struct ccn_charbuf *prefix,
00151                 const struct ccn_charbuf *name,
00152                 int start);
00153 
00154 /**
00155  * @returns number of components in the longest prefix of both x and y
00156  * @returns -1 if there is a parsing error
00157  */
00158 int
00159 SyncComponentMatch(const struct ccn_charbuf *x,
00160                    const struct ccn_charbuf *y);
00161 
00162 /**
00163  * finds the bytes for a component (not including the tag)
00164  * src must be a name, comp the component index
00165  * @returns < 0 for an error, 0 otherwise
00166  */
00167 int
00168 SyncGetComponentPtr(const struct ccn_charbuf *src, int comp,
00169                     const unsigned char **xp, ssize_t *xs);
00170 
00171 /**
00172  * appends components from src to dst (both must be names)
00173  * @returns < 0 for an error
00174  * @returns the number of components copied otherwise
00175  */
00176 int
00177 SyncAppendAllComponents(struct ccn_charbuf *dst,
00178                         const struct ccn_charbuf *src);
00179 
00180 /**
00181  * Convenience routine to make a name from a ccn_indexbuf.
00182  * The storage for the returned charbuf is owned by the caller.
00183  * @returns a charbuf for the name (NULL if an error)
00184  */
00185 struct ccn_charbuf *
00186 SyncNameForIndexbuf(const unsigned char *buf, struct ccn_indexbuf *comps);
00187 
00188 /**
00189  * Convenience routine to make a uri for a name.
00190  * The storage for the returned charbuf is owned by the caller.
00191  * @returns the charbuf with the uri for the name (NULL if an error)
00192  */
00193 struct ccn_charbuf *
00194 SyncUriForName(struct ccn_charbuf *name);
00195 
00196 /**
00197  * Convenience routine to make a Sync protocol command prefix for a marker.
00198  * The returned name includes the topo prefix, the marker, and the slice hash.
00199  * The storage for the returned charbuf is owned by the caller.
00200  * @returns the charbuf with the uri for the name (NULL if an error)
00201  */
00202 struct ccn_charbuf *
00203 SyncConstructCommandPrefix(struct SyncRootStruct *root, char *marker);

00210 struct SyncHashInfoList {
00211     struct SyncHashInfoList *next;
00212     struct SyncHashCacheEntry *ce;
00213     int64_t lastSeen;
00214     int64_t lastReplied;
00215 };
00216 
00217 /**
00218  * finds the hash code, storing the pointer to *xp and the length to *xs
00219  * if the hash is valid (test for *xs != 0 to be sure)
00220  * a hash code may be a ContentHash, or the last component of a Name
00221  * (for convenience, a Component may also be used)
00222  * non-destructive to the decoder
00223  * no error codes, but a pointer is set only for valid cases
00224  */
00225 void
00226 SyncGetHashPtr(const struct ccn_buf_decoder *hd,
00227                const unsigned char **xp, ssize_t *xs);
00228 
00229 /**
00230  * compares two hash codes in charbufs
00231  * @returns < 0 for X < Y, 0 for X = Y, > 0 for X > Y
00232  */
00233 int
00234 SyncCmpHashesRaw(const unsigned char *xp, ssize_t xs,
00235                  const unsigned char *yp, ssize_t ys);
00236 
00237 /**
00238  * compares two hash codes in charbufs
00239  * @returns < 0 for X < Y, 0 for X = Y, > 0 for X > Y
00240  */
00241 int
00242 SyncCompareHash(struct ccn_charbuf *hashX, struct ccn_charbuf *hashY);

00246 // hash code is raw bytes
00247 void
00248 SyncAccumHashRaw(struct SyncLongHashStruct *hp,
00249                  const unsigned char *xp, size_t xs);
00250

00252 // into the hash accumulator for the composite node
00253 // non-destructive of decoder
00254 void
00255 SyncAccumHashInner(struct SyncLongHashStruct *hp,
00256                    const struct ccn_buf_decoder *d);

00259 // into the hash accumulator for the composite node
00260 // non-destructive of decoder
00261 void
00262 SyncAccumHash(struct SyncLongHashStruct *hp, const struct ccn_charbuf *cb);

00265 struct ccn_charbuf *
00266 SyncLongHashToBuf(const struct SyncLongHashStruct *hp);

00269 // useful to speed up hash table lookups
00270 uint32_t
00271 SyncSmallHash(const unsigned char * xp, ssize_t xs);

00273 // maintains a hash info list, sorted by most recent first (lastSeen)
00274 struct SyncHashInfoList *
00275 SyncNoteHash(struct SyncHashInfoList *head, struct SyncHashCacheEntry *ce);

00296 int
00297 SyncAppendRandomBytes(struct ccn_charbuf *cb, int n);
00298 
00299 // appends a random hash code as a ContentHash
00300 int
00301 SyncAppendRandomHash(struct ccn_charbuf *cb, int n);
00302 
00303 // appends a random name of nComp random-length components plus a random hash
00304 int
00305 SyncAppendRandomName(struct ccn_charbuf *cb, int nComp, int maxCompLen);
00306 
00307 // appendElementInner appends the ccnb encoding from the decoder to the cb output
00308 // types supported: CCN_DTAG_Name, CCN_DTAG_SyncContentHash, CCN_DTAG_BinaryValue
00309 // any error returns < 0
00310 // this routine advances the decoder!
00311 int
00312 SyncAppendElementInner(struct ccn_charbuf *cb, struct ccn_buf_decoder *d);
00313 
00314 // appendElement appends the ccnb encoding from the src to the dst
00315 // types supported: CCN_DTAG_Name, CCN_DTAG_SyncContentHash, CCN_DTAG_BinaryValue
00316 // any error returns < 0
00317 int
00318 SyncAppendElement(struct ccn_charbuf *dst, const struct ccn_charbuf *src);

00360  * @returns a new name accum with at least lim space for names

00362 struct SyncNameAccum *
00363 SyncAllocNameAccum(int lim);

00366  * frees the name accum, but not the names
00367  * @returns NULL
00368  */
00369 struct SyncNameAccum *
00370 SyncFreeNameAccum(struct SyncNameAccum *na);

00376 struct SyncNameAccum *

00380  * default sorter callback for a name accum
00381  * uses CCN standard name order

00384 SyncNameAccumSorter(IndexSorter_Base base,
00385                     IndexSorter_Index x, IndexSorter_Index y);

00388  * appends a new name with associated data
00389  * important: the name is not copied!
00390  */
00391 int
00392 SyncNameAccumAppend(struct SyncNameAccum *na,
00393                     struct ccn_charbuf *name,
00394                     intmax_t data);
00395 
00396 /**
00397  * canonicalizes a name with respect to the given name accum
00398  * should be used for relatively small canon sets
00399  * @returns an equal name if it was in the accum
00400  * @returns a copy of the name (and enters it) if no equal name was in the accum
00401  */
00402 struct ccn_charbuf *
00403 SyncNameAccumCanon(struct SyncNameAccum *na,
00404                    const struct ccn_charbuf *name);

00421 /**
00422  * Adds the given name to any applicable roots.
00423  * Use seq_num == 0 to ignore sequence number.
00424  * @returns < 0 for failure, number of additions to roots for success.
00425  */
00426 int
00427 SyncAddName(struct SyncBaseStruct *base, struct ccn_charbuf *name, uint64_t seq_num);
00428 
00429 /**
00430  * takes a list of names and sort them, removing duplicates
00431  * names are transfered to the return accum, so src is left empty
00432  * @returns an accum with the sorted names
00433  */
00434 extern struct SyncNameAccum *
00435 SyncSortNames(struct SyncRootStruct *root, struct SyncNameAccum *src);

00466 /**
00467  * given a charbuf cb for a content object, with optional parsing offsets in pco,
00468  * sets *xp and *xs with the pointer and length of the actual content bytes
00469  * @returns < 0 for failure
00470  */
00471 int
00472 SyncPointerToContent(struct ccn_charbuf *cb, struct ccn_parsed_ContentObject *pco,
00473                      const unsigned char **xp, size_t *xs);

00476 /**
00477  * given a charbuf cb and name for a content object, signs the bytes and
00478  * @returns the signed buffer (NULL for failure)
00479  */
00480 struct ccn_charbuf *
00481 SyncSignBuf(struct SyncBaseStruct *base,
00482             struct ccn_charbuf *cb,
00483             struct ccn_charbuf *name,
00484             long fresh, int flags);

00487 /**
00488  * given a local repo name and a buffer to fill,
00489  * fills cb with the content object (note: not the content itself)
00490  * pco is filled as a useful side effect, but may be NULL
00491  * @returns < 0 if the node fails
00492  */
00493 int
00494 SyncLocalRepoFetch(struct SyncBaseStruct *base,
00495                    struct ccn_charbuf *name,
00496                    struct ccn_charbuf *cb,
00497                    struct ccn_parsed_ContentObject *pco);
